short_bio: Award-winning chef with a passion for sustainable cooking.

recipes.cooking_method: 1. Rinse the quinoa and cook in boiling salted water for 15 minutes. 2. Cut the cherry tomatoes and cucumber into bite-sized pieces. 3. Combine the cooked quinoa, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, feta cheese, and red onion in a large bowl. 4. Toss well and serve chilled.

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F. 2. Peel and chop the carrots, parsnips, and sweet potatoes into bite-sized pieces. 3. Toss the vegetables with olive oil and salt in a large bowl. 4. Spread the vegetables on a baking sheet and roast for 30-40 minutes, until tender and lightly browned.

1. Peel and devein the shrimp. 2. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. 3. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, until fragrant. 4. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until pink and cooked through. 5. Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the shrimp and sprinkle with salt to taste.

short_bio: Innovative chef specializing in fusion cuisine.

recipes.cooking_method: 1. Preheat the oven to 400°F. 2. In a large bowl, mix together flour, cornstarch, and salt. 3. Dredge the chicken wings in the flour mixture and shake off the excess. 4. Bake the chicken wings for 25-30 minutes, until crispy and cooked through. 5. In a small bowl, mix together gochujang and honey. 6. Toss the baked chicken wings in the gochujang mixture until coated.

1. Cook sushi rice according to package instructions. 2. Place a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat. 3. Spread a thin layer of rice over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top. 4. Add sliced avocado, cucumber, and carrots in a line down the center of the rice. 5. Use the bamboo mat to roll the sushi tightly, using the border of rice at the top to seal the roll. 6. Slice the sushi into rounds and serve with soy sauce and wasabi.

1. Cook pasta according to package instructions. 2. In a food processor, combine basil, garlic, parmesan cheese, and pine nuts. 3. Process until finely chopped. 4. With the processor running, slowly pour in olive oil until the mixture forms a smooth paste. 5. Toss the cooked pasta with the pesto sauce until coated. 6. Serve hot with extra parmesan cheese.

1. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat. 2. Add garlic, ginger, and Sichuan peppercorns and stir-fry for 30 seconds. 3. Add ground pork and cook until browned. 4. Add fermented black beans, chili bean paste, and chicken broth. 5. Add diced tofu and cook until heated through. 6. Thicken the sauce with cornstarch slurry. 7. Garnish with green onions and serve over rice.

1. Cut chicken breast into small pieces and coat with cornstarch. 2. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. 3. Add dried red chili peppers and stir-fry for 30 seconds. 4. Add chicken and stir-fry until browned. 5. Add soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, and sugar. 6. Cook until the sauce thickens. 7. Garnish with chopped peanuts and green onions and serve over rice.

1. Clean and scale the whole fish. 2. Cut a few slits into the fish and stuff with ginger and green onions. 3. Place the fish in a steamer basket and steam for 10-12 minutes. 4. Heat soy sauce, rice wine, and sesame oil in a small saucepan. 5. Pour the sauce over the steamed fish. 6. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot.

short_bio: Master chef trained in French and Italian culinary techniques.

recipes.cooking_method: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. 2. Brown bacon in a large Dutch oven or ovenproof pot over medium-high heat. 3. Remove bacon and set aside. 4. Season chicken thighs with salt and pepper and brown in the bacon fat. 5. Remove chicken and set aside. 6. Add pearl onions, carrots, and mushrooms to the pot and cook until lightly browned. 7. Add red wine, chicken broth, and thyme. 8. Return chicken and bacon to the pot. 9. Cover and bake for 1 hour, or until chicken is cooked through.

1. Cook spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente. 2. In a large skillet, cook pancetta until crisp. 3. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. 4. In a small bowl, beat eggs and Parmesan cheese together. 5. Drain spaghetti and add to the skillet with pancetta. 6. Remove from heat and pour egg mixture over spaghetti. 7. Toss until the spaghetti is coated in the egg mixture. 8. Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

1. Preheat oven to 350°F. 2. Cut beef chuck into 2-inch pieces and season with salt and pepper. 3. Brown bacon in a large Dutch oven or ovenproof pot over medium-high heat. 4. Remove bacon and set aside. 5. Brown beef in the bacon fat. 6. Remove beef and set aside. 7. Add carrots and onions to the pot and cook until lightly browned. 8. Add red wine, beef broth, and thyme. 9. Return beef and bacon to the pot. 10. Cover and bake for 2-3 hours, or until beef is tender.

short_bio: Latin-inspired chef with a focus on bold flavors.

recipes.cooking_method: 1. Preheat oven to 375°F. 2. Brown chicken thighs in a large oven-safe skillet. 3. Remove chicken and set aside. 4. Add onion and garlic to the skillet and cook until softened. 5. Add tomato sauce, chicken broth, and rice to the skillet. 6. Nestle the chicken thighs into the rice mixture. 7. Cover and bake for 45-50 minutes, or until rice is cooked and chicken is cooked through.

1. Combine raw shrimp and lime juice in a large bowl. 2. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes to 1 hour, or until the shrimp are cooked through. 3. Add diced red onion, chopped tomatoes, chopped cilantro, and diced jalapeno to the bowl. 4. Toss to combine. 5. Serve chilled with tortilla chips.

1. Preheat oven to 375°F. 2. Brown ground beef in a large skillet. 3. Add onion and red bell pepper to the skillet and cook until softened. 4. Add cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper to the skillet and stir to combine. 5. Roll out puff pastry and cut into 4-inch circles. 6. Spoon the ground beef mixture onto each circle of pastry. 7. Fold the pastry over to create a half-moon shape. 8. Use a fork to press the edges of the pastry together to seal. 9. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until pastry is golden brown.

short_bio: In-demand chef specializing in farm-to-table cuisine.

recipes.name: Grilled Ribeye Steak
recipes.cooking_method: Preheat grill to high heat. Brush steak with olive oil and season with garlic powder, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Grill for 5-6 minutes on each side for medium-rare. Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Pesto Pasta with Roasted Vegetables
recipes.cooking_method: Preheat oven to 400°F. Toss sliced vegetables with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Roast for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender and lightly browned. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and toss with pesto. Serve topped with roasted vegetables and grated Parmesan cheese.

recipes.name: Grilled Salmon with Avocado Salsa
recipes.cooking_method: Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Brush salmon with olive oil and season with cumin, chili powder, and garlic powder. Grill for 4-5 minutes on each side until cooked through. In a separate bowl, mix together diced avocado, cherry tomatoes, red onion, lime juice, and cilantro to make the salsa. Serve salmon topped with avocado salsa.
